etymology.description: Depicts an infant with an imperfect cranium (fontanelle)
etymology.interpretation: The character 兒 (ér, 'child') visually represents an infant, highlighting the soft spot on a baby's head, known as the fontanelle. This pictogram effectively conveys the idea of a young child through its depiction.
etymology.simplification: 兒 (ér) was simplified to 儿 (ér) by eliminating 臼 (jiù, 'mortar'), which represented the fontanelle, simplifying the character to represent just the form of a standing person.

examples.chinese: 这个兒很聪明(這個儿很聰明)。
他看见兒在公园玩耍(他看見儿在公園玩耍)，心里很高兴(心裡很高興)。
examples.pinyin: Tā kànjiàn ér zài gōngyuán wánshuǎ, xīn lǐ hěn gāoxìng.
examples.english: He saw the child playing in the park, and his heart was filled with joy.

examples.chinese: 父亲教儿学习知识(父親教儿學習知識)。
examples.english: The father teaches the child knowledge.
